title: Jimmy Fallon confuses US and Australian Today shows in awkward tweet
text:
Jimmy Fallon is one of the most popular talk show hosts in America.

And on Tuesday, he sent his Australian fans into a frenzy by tweeting that he would be appearing on Channel Nine's Today show.

But in an awkward twist, he later revealed he had tagged the wrong Twitter account and would actually be going on NBC's Today show.

Whoops! On Tuesday, Jimmy Fallon sent his Australian fans into a frenzy by tweeting that he would be appearing on Channel Nine's Today show

The Tonight Show host didn't realise his mistake for several hours and was forced to issue a clarification on Twitter.

He tweeted: 'Okay - to be clear - I'm on at 8:20 on @Todayshow. I am not on @TheTodayShow in Australia. But I'd love to be one day!'

Jimmy was scheduled to appear on the American Today show to promote his new children's book, This is Baby.

Oh, dear! But in an awkward twist, Jimmy later revealed he had tagged the wrong Twitter account and would actually be going on NBC's Today show. Pictured: Channel Nine hosts Deborah Knight (left) and Georgie Gardner (right)

'To be clear': The Tonight Show host didn't realise his mistake for several hours and was forced to issue a clarification on Twitter (pictured)

Begging: Meanwhile, Today show host Deborah Knight encouraged Jimmy to visit Australia anyway, tweeting, 'C'mon Jimmy - we'd love to have you Down Under!'

Meanwhile, Today show host Deborah Knight encouraged Jimmy to visit Australia anyway, tweeting: 'C'mon Jimmy - we'd love to have you Down Under!'

Other fans begged the former Saturday Night Live star, 45, to fly over and pay a visit to the Irwins at Australia Zoo.

Bindi and Robert Irwin are regular guests on Jimmy's U.S. talk show, where they host wildlife segments.

Wrong show! Jimmy was scheduled to appear on NBC's Today show (pictured) to promote his new children's book, This is Baby

The Tonight Show starring Jimmy Fallon aired in Australia on E! until recently, but is now no longer on the schedule.

A network spokesperson told TV Tonight earlier this month: 'We have enjoyed having The Tonight Show as part of our E! Australia family.

'As we bid farewell to The Tonight Show in Australia, we look forward to sharing a slate of exciting new and continuing programs for our viewers on E!'
